Row.Text: [NEWLINE][COLOR_WARNING_TEXT][ICON_JFD_SHACKLES] Slaves earn 50% less XP from combat and cost 100% more to upgrade. However, they may move immediately after purchase.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Spending [ICON_JFD_SHACKLES] Shackles will increase progress toward your [ICON_RESISTANCE] Resistance Counter.[ENDCOLOR]

Enslaving the city will grant {1_Num} [ICON_JFD_SHACKLES] Shackles, reducing the city's [ICON_CITIZEN] Population by {2_Num}.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]It will cause the city to go into [ICON_RESISTANCE] Resistance for {3_Num} turns.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]This action will otherwise {4_Text} the city.[ENDCOLOR]

[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Annexing[ENDCOLOR] the City into your empire causes it to become a normal City that produces quite a bit of extra [ICON_HAPPINESS_4] Unhappiness.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]It will not cause the city to go into [ICON_RESISTANCE] Resistance, but will contribute {2_Num} toward the city's [ICON_RESISTANCE] Resistance Counter.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Annexing this City will increase [ICON_HAPPINESS_4] Unhappiness by {1_Num}.
Click to sort by the amount of [ICON_JFD_SHACKLES] Shackles that the city that established the trade route generates from this trade route.
Click to sort by the amount of [ICON_JFD_SHACKLES] Shackles that the destination city would receive from this trade route.
You are receiving +{1_Num} [ICON_JFD_SHACKLES] Shackles on this route to your city.
They are receiving +{1_Num} [ICON_JFD_SHACKLES] Shackles on this route from your city.
